intro: Cyrtandra petila, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Cyrtandra petila is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native ecosystems.
